But Paddy, Freddie and Chris aren't crossing the Himalayas in new 4x4s. programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Herbert Rowse Armstrong, who was convicted of murdering his wife with arsenic. Much of the evidence against him was circumstantial and the scientific testimony remains disputed. This episode examines both sides of the case and asks whether the British justice system made a terrible mistake.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Robert Laycock who rallied his ill-equipped troops to see off a German attack on Crete, Greece.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: How Field Marshall Erich von Manstein's escape from the Red Army influenced Nato's defence plans.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Falkirk wheel is the first and only rotating boat lift, capable of moving 600 tonnes of boat and water over a 25-metre height difference in just minutes.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund Blackadder, conniving courtier to Elizabeth I, takes in a spirited lad as his manservant - unaware the fellow is actually a woman out to make her fortune. Classic comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Miranda Richardson and Stephen Fry, with a guest appearance by Rik Mayall as Edmund's best friend Lord Flashheart.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Amelia Dyer, who promised mothers that for a fee she would adopt their babies and raise them as her own. In fact, she neglected and murdered countless infants over a 30-year period in Victorian Britain. This episode tells the story of Dyer and of Evelina Marmon, one of the desperate young mothers she deceived.

programme.desc: A devastated cliff-top ruin, an extraordinarily tall tower, a concrete structure stranded at sea and a heavy metal monster in a field all feature.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An Albanian village home to Allied secret agents, devastated for resisting the Nazi war machine, and a notorious asylum in America that enforced lobotomies.

programme.title: The Story of Only Fools and Horses

programme.desc: The unsolved murders committed by the Butcher of Kingsbury Run, a serial killer operating in Cleveland, Ohio, in the 1930s. The Butcher killed at least 12 men and women, dismembering their bodies and scattering them across the city.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Roy Urquhart, who successfully evaded the enemy in his retreat across the Rhine after leading British troops into a doomed attack at Arnhem.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day.

programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Saluting Dad's Army
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong celebrates the genius and impact of enduring classic BBC sitcom Dad's Army paying tribute to those who created it. programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David puts his money worries aside to captain the local cricket team in a grudge match against their rivals _ but is the game up for the bungling businessman? Hussan uses a cheap trick to try to win Jess back, while Anna refuses to let Simon help her with the baby, determined to go it alone, but finds comfort in sharing her woes with young mum Marie Briggs, who is also struggling to cope with the pressures of single parenthood. Small-town drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie, newly released from hospital, meets the family at the Victorian mansion for their holiday - but things aren't exactly relaxing.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Gladys agrees to marry Clive - much to his family's dismay. Comedy, starring Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean begins to think that, 19 months after tying the knot, her marriage may have become stale. She wonders whether a few surprises from Lionel would spice things up, so Alistair, helped by Judith and Sandy, comes up with a plan to give her the treat of a lifetime.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cyril Blamire leaves to live in Oswestry, after hearing a lady he is interested in has become a widow. However, his old friend Foggy Dewhurst arrives in the village, and soon makes his presence known to the locals. Brian Wilde stars.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge hears the case of three men accused of shooting a rival gang member - but the trial is in danger of collapsing when the prosecution's main witness is killed in a hit-and-run incident. To make matters worse, the jurors start to fall sick, and the newly appointed Home Secretary sees a chance to make it into a jury-less trial - which could force Deed to throw it out altogether. Martin Shaw stars, with Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: New information links the unexplained death of a market trader to a series of drug rapes in east London - but with that case still ongoing, Ucos officers are unable to question the chief suspect, so they have to look into their victim's past in their search for clues. Gerry finds a likely culprit in the shape of the market inspector who clamped his car, while Sandra has problems of a more personal nature when her hated mother arrives for a visit. Sheila Hancock guest stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. After a naked woman is found fleeing a car accident, she is taken to hospital and tests reveal her DNA is linked to a double murder in 1960s Soho. Boyd discovers the victim, successful entrepreneur Elizabeth Andrews, has suffered a horrific attack at the hands of her abductors and he is led to her home, where a man presumed to be her husband is found hanged in the hallway. With a new murder as well as the cold case to solve, the team tries to connect the crimes, but a greater danger awaits Elizabeth in hospital. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and his real-life wife Sharon Maughan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Gina returns to her job immediately after receiving treatment for her cancer. Clearly unfit for work but too stubborn to admit it, she relies on June to oversee the relief. Gary is shot during a raid on a gang suspected of handling stolen goods, while Phil bristles with righteous indignation at the discovery that Kate has been mugged at knifepoint and vows to catch the thug responsible. As for Adam, he hits another snag as he tries to get his road safety initiative up and running, and again asks Isaac Collins to help - unaware his old friend's shady past is about to catch up with him.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch boys tackle two different, but equally dangerous and challenging blazes, one at a car-breaker's yard, the other in a Chinese restaurant.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Charles returns for a second night in the hot seat with a new strategy. After his previously hopeless performance, he proves massively successful, his dithering answers invariably turning out to be right. However, the production team find his sudden change of fortunes suspicious, and begin looking into an unusual pattern of coughing from the studio audience.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster leaves central Manchester, heading east along the Rochdale Canal. Not long into his journey, John finds himself struggling to contend with 19th-century technology at a cotton works. Further up the canal, he helps out members of an conservation group clearing the waterway of dumped supermarket trollies. After passing into West Yorkshire, it's on to Hebden Bridge, famous for the hard-wearing material corduroy, before John tries his hand at clog-making in one of Britain's few remaining factories dedicated to the craft.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Andrea McLean, Denise Welch, Janet Street Porter and Stacey Solomon make up the Loose Women panel for this episode, discussing all of the day's most topical issues, from current affairs and politics to all the juiciest celebrity gossip and the latest showbiz news. They're joined on the panel by husband and wife stars Martin and Shirlie Kemp to talk about how it's been watching their son Roman's I'm A Celebrity...adventure.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: This time, the chef travels to south Wales, where he is accompanied by Michelin-starred chef Stephen Terry. James cooks a Welsh lamb ragu on a beautiful mountainside, and samples award-winning Welsh wine and organic Welsh chocolate. Later, he visits Shaun Hill at his renowned restaurant, The Walnut Tree.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a family from Birmingham answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Mandy feels total dread when Vinny's father reveals he has come back for his son, while Leyla and Kerry worry when they realise Lydia has yet to be seen on her wedding day. Dan insists to an attentive Amelia that he can look after himself, and Vanessa and Charity are dropped off at the chemotherapy unit.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Amy's party soon gets out of hand when naked pictures of Asha are sent from Corey's phone to the party people' group chat and Corey accidentally smashes one of Tracy's new lamps. Leanne catches Steve red-handed, Johnny has an unwanted visitor and Ed and Aggie sit down to a romantic dinner.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: When Kate's flashy ex-husband Dennis arrives in town with his much younger wife, Kate feigns an attachment to Koji. Councillor Bone is sure their relationship is a front, but that does not stop a good old-fashioned show down at the pub. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn, Jimmy Akingbola and Barbara Flynn.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul helps to feed a pair of week-old kittens whose mother has abandoned them. However, as the kittens grow older, the team discover that one of them has a neurological problem affecting his movement. Later, Paul meets a group of dogs from a puppy farm who have had very little human interaction in the past, and need help learning how to socialise.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Persecuted and hounded by the public and press, Charles, Diana and Tecwen head to court. At first it seems the case for the prosecution is solid, but as the case for the defence gets underway, the jury learn there is far more to the story than they first thought. Drama, starring Matthew Macfadyen and Sian Clifford.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town reaches a conclusion after a multitude of twist and turns, countless red herrings and numerous suspects with shaky alibis. In the last-ever episode the truth is finally revealed as detectives Alec Hardy and Ellie Miller finally untangle the web of deceit surrounding the rape of Trish Winterman. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry.

programme.title: STV News and Weather

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Michelin-starred chef Gareth Ward for a tour of Mid Wales. They begin at a cider-tasting, which James uses to dish up some cider-infused apple fritters. Gareth discovers a farm where the Wagyu cattle fed on local beer. Away from the culinary activities, Gareth is challenged to a rally car ride and James demonstrates his dog training prowess with his trusty hound Cooper.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. Highlights include a man accidentally throwing a hammer through his patio door, a young couple interrupted during a romantic proposal and a woman in labour who decides to play a prank on her midwife.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.sub-title: The Martin Lewis Money Show - A Coronavirus Special
programme.desc: The financial concerns resulting from the coronavirus.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Summer of Love (San Francisco and Napa Valley)
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix head to San Francisco, the free-spirited capital of the United States. They start out by sampling the latest trends of using cannabis in cooking, which was legalised in California in 2018 - but as they enjoy a hippy afternoon tea, Gino overindulges and chaos ensues, especially when the next activity on the agenda is a session of goat yoga. Moving on, the trio dig for clams on the Pacific coast, take a hot-air ride to a vineyard and visit a factory in Chinatown where fortune cookies are made. It seems a competition is in order and so the travel companions see who can make the most cookies in 60 seconds.

programme.title: Euro 96: The Summer Football Came Home
programme.desc: A look back at the tournament, which was staged in England and saw the hosts enjoy a memorable run to the semi-finals. Highlights on the field included Paul Gascoigne's individual brilliance against Scotland, Stuart Pearce's moment of redemption against Spain and the all-round excellence of England's demolition of the Dutch. With contributions from Terry Venables, Stuart Pearce, David Seaman and Teddy Sheringham.

programme.title: Get Shirty
programme.desc: Documentary examining how a small underwear company from Leicester turned the world of football upside down when it invented a replica kit and established an industry now worth billions of pounds.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: A revelation about Charles' past spells disaster for John and jeopardises his entire future. Anne receives a visit from a former employee, giving Ellis an idea of how to make some money - but she is not as cunning as she thinks. Oliver tries to find ammunition against Charles, and Lady Templemore stands firm on her plans for Maria's upcoming engagement, meaning the young woman must take matters into her own hands.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Asha is sickened to realise somebody posted her naked pictures and they have gone viral, while Leanne is furious to realise Steve is seriously considering taking legal advice. Johnny takes matters into his own hands and Ken's election campaign is on the up.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The host interviews former Baywatch star and Playboy centrefold Pamela Anderson, who reflects on her career and turbulent personal life. She talks about her first husband Tommy Lee, whom she married following a whirlwind four-day courtship, and discusses the nature of her recent relationship with WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange. She also opens up about her role as an animal rights activist, including persuading Vladimir Putin to ban the import of seal products into Russia.

programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are after the president's jokebook. But Magoo, thinking he's in his dojo, enters the high-security unit where it's kept....

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo's going to miss his flight. Unfortunately, he's not at the airport, but the supermarket, where Fizz and Weasel are hatching their latest plan..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.sub-title: The Prophecy of the Goldensand'S Dragon
programme.desc: Fizz is at the beach building a sandcastle. Magoo thinks they are preparing to thwart an attack by an enemy riding a dragon..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket becomes inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing. Mr. Bean investigates..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean has finished his model car collection, what next? What about football stickers?.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: During medieval times, Team Tennyson must fight to remember that they're not in the past at all, but actually at a Renaissance-esque faire.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Anna is practising for the school cycling test and is good at it. Dave isn't quite as skilled, but with a new bike from his parents he really hopes to pass..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by guests Roman Kemp and Vick Hope, and chefs Marcus Wareing and Jose Pizarro. Plus, Bettina Campolucci Bordi demonstrates some vegan recipes.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Paul Ainsworth to explore the culinary delights of Dorset, with the pair going aboard a millionaire's yacht, where James cooks a sea bass dish. Paul samples local cheeses, while James visits a breeder with Mangalitsa pigs in a beautiful coastline setting.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Sardinia continues in the Nuoro region, where his guide Claudio takes him to meet his parents, who run a small bakery specialising in pane carasau, a thin crispy bread found all over the island. Claudio then takes the chef to his family's citrus farm to discover local fruit the pompia, a citrus so bitter it is never eaten raw but makes a fabulous liqueur. Moving up to the hills, Ainsley cooks a traditional sheep stew with a group of shepherds, visits one of the island's ancient archaeological sites and cooks up a Sardinian-style minestrone.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team heads to the Yorkshire Dales to surprise Jim Thompson, a terminally ill 65-year-old grandfather and fundraiser. Despite Jim's own diagnosis, his commitment to spreading awareness and raising money for prostate cancer charities are legendary in the area, including creating a 'Calendar Girls' style naked calendar. Inspired by his bravery and dedication, the makeover team decide to turn Jim's overgrown and dangerous plot into a classic cottage garden with a Yorkshire twist.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute leads to murder after a stalwart in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe as Barnaby and Jones investigate. Guest starring Hugo Speer (Bleak House), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Ricky Wilson, Russell Kane and Chizzy Akudolu to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Sarah Willingham, Shaun Ryder, Michelle Dewberry and Eddie Edwards pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle course challenge, including weatherman Alex Beresford and former British Rugby player Maggie Alphonsi. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from Swansea, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: American television presenter Jerry Springer, Strictly Come Dancing co-host Tess Daly and presenter of dating game show Take Me Out Paddy McGuinness make up this week's panel as Keith Lemon noses around the homes of mystery stars, rummaging through their most treasured possessions. With the help of the studio audience, the panellists use clues highlighted along each tour to work out which famous faces have agreed to hand over their house keys to the Celebrity Juice funnyman.

programme.title: Crank (2006)
programme.desc: An assassin faces a race against time when he learns a rival has poisoned him with a drug that will kill him if his heart rate drops below a certain level. As he sets out to take revenge on his enemies, he has to resort to increasingly desperate acts to keep his adrenaline pumping. Action thriller, with Jason Statham, Amy Smart and Jose Pablo Cantillo.

programme.desc: Can George and Harold destroy homework by making sure it was never invented in the first place?.

programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses.

programme.desc: This time, the chef travels to south Wales, where he is accompanied by Michelin-starred chef Stephen Terry. James cooks a Welsh lamb ragu on a beautiful mountainside, and samples award-winning Welsh wine and organic Welsh chocolate. Later, he visits Shaun Hill at his renowned restaurant, The Walnut Tree.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches North Africa and the Moroccan city of Marrakesh. He visits a restaurant famous for cooking whole lambs in an underground oven, has a masterclass from local chef Cedric, who shows him how to make traditional food with a fancy twist, and hits the main square for some street food. Throughout the show he prepares flat breads with tomato salsa, barbecue corn on the cob with local spice spicy ras el hanout and whole fish with chermoula.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner prepare potato curry, rhubarb crumble and asparagus with Hollandaise. Gino D'Acampo cooks chicken in beer in Sardinia and The Great British Bake Off's Jane Beedle demonstrates a gluten-free roulade.

programme.desc: A storm-chaser and her estranged husband are brought together in a joint project to monitor the path of an oncoming tornado - but the pair face a race against the clock as a rival government-backed group with hi-tech resources tries to beat them to it. Action thriller, starring Helen Hunt, Bill Paxton, Cary Elwes, Jami Gertz and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: The team members are hit hard by a life-or-death emergency, forcing Gabriel to face his true feelings. Lydia's determination to help Jyoti get better comes at a great personal cost to the doctor. Ted seeks closure as he prepares to leave India. Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Kenneth Cranham and Sayani Gupta.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: The conclusion of Julian Fellowes' drama about secrets and lies in uptight 19th-century London society. James travels to Manchester to investigate the allegations made against Charles, but soon realises there are greater threats at play. Lady Templemore employs Reggie to make Lady Maria change her mind, but her daughter will not give in so easily. Susan is in danger of losing everything after her secret is revealed, but as ever she uses her cunning to twist the situation to her own and others' benefit, while Charles is puzzled to receive a mysterious olive branch. Keen to end the feuding, he seeks out the offer of reconciliation - unaware he is being lured into danger.

programme.title: Exposure
programme.desc: Jonathan Maitland presents an undercover report on the fast-growing sport of white-collar boxing, whereby people with little or no experience of fighting train to appear in special bouts, often for charity. Two undercover reporters attend training sessions at gyms in Leeds and London to find out how safe it is for those who take part.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: On the NHS Frontline
programme.desc: First of two programmes in which Ross Kemp follows frontline medical staff in Milton Keynes Hospital Trust as they prepare for and face the coronavirus pandemic. He witnesses the sacrifices staff and their families are making in their battle against the disease. And he follows the journey of patients admitted into the hospital's respiratory ward with mild symptoms, through to the intensive care units, where those with severe Covid-19 fight for their lives.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. Highlights include a man accidentally throwing a hammer through his patio door, a young couple interrupted during a romantic proposal and a woman in labour who decides to play a prank on her midwife.

programme.desc: The team are in Hackney, where they surprise Jeroume and Onessa Cariazo, the parents of wheelchair-bound nine-year-old Elijah, who has rare genetic condition myotubular myopathy. Alan Titchmarsh, Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney give Elijah the sensory stimulation he craves, transforming the family's uneven overgrown urban courtyard into an accessible paradise complete with tropical water feature, a sensory beach and Asian-style dining zone.

programme.title: A Mother's Son
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama, starring Hermione Norris, Martin Clunes, Paul McGann and Alexander Arnold. The murder of a schoolgirl rocks the residents of a quiet coastal town in Suffolk, and when Rosie stumbles upon a pair of bloodstained trainers hidden in her home, she suspects someone in her family may have been involved in the killing. With her son Jamie and stepson Rob both acting suspiciously, could she be right?.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Summer of Love (San Francisco and Napa Valley)
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Gino D'Acampo and Fred Sirieix head to San Francisco, the free-spirited capital of the United States. They start out by sampling the latest trends of using cannabis in cooking, which was legalised in California in 2018 - but as they enjoy a hippy afternoon tea, Gino overindulges and chaos ensues, especially when the next activity on the agenda is a session of goat yoga. Moving on, the trio dig for clams on the Pacific coast, take a hot-air ride to a vineyard and visit a factory in Chinatown where fortune cookies are made. It seems a competition is in order and so the travel companions see who can make the most cookies in 60 seconds.

programme.title: A Very British Lockdown: Diaries from the Frontline
programme.desc: Documentary featuring a wide cross-section of people as they record their own stories on camera phones - charting the everyday courage, kindness, anxiety and humour they experience as the nation strives to 'Keep Calm and Carry On'. From shopkeepers to home-schooling parents, care workers to cleaners, teachers to nurses, the film reveals what HM The Queen recently called 'our quiet, good humoured resolve'. Others - such as expectant Mums and the sick and elderly - show their bravery in the face of the coronavirus.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster takes in the delights of the Lancaster Canal, setting out from Tewitfield. As he meanders down the waterway, John cannot resist visiting Carnforth railway station, where he re-enacts his favourite scene from the classic film Brief Encounter, some of which was filmed there. After Carnforth, the canal crosses the River Lune on its way to Lancaster, where the veteran journalist marvels at the engineering of the Lune Aqueduct. Later, he heads south to Garstang, famous for its cheeses, and finally on towards Preston.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China embark on a project to restore an original Austin Mini.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work continues on the Austin Mini's restoration, as Edd China and Mike Brewer prepare to return the car to the road.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: A French museum asks eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton for help in acquiring an incredibly rare German Panzer 1 tank. He also explores the remains of secret underground Nazi war factorie.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The crew build a custom chopper for Kobalt Tools and Paul Jr gathers the family for a life-changing announcement.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Kevin green lights Heather's first solo repo, to which she pays the price for her mistakes. Meanwhile, Mike returns to Puerto Rico to recover a relic from the old family business.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe works at an exotic animal ranch in Texas, but has trouble getting along with its wallabies and lemurs. However, his toughest challenge involves trimming a bearcat's claws.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The complex manufacturing processes behind the production of mouth-blown window glass, water pumps, sake, and tweezers.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The documentary outlining various manufacturing processes continues, this time focusing on statue restoration, and the production of tripods, Polish sausages and welding guns.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes that allow people to build diesel engines that can fly, make cough sweets, turn clear plastic into unforgeable bank notes, and produce ice-cream.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard spots a 1960s Mini that may be for sale - can he buy it at a good price? Plus, a Cotswold dealer has a Porsche 928, but the budget is hit by some major repairs.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Deckhand Jake suffers an injury as the Northwestern's crew struggles to keep up with the maniacal pace of Captain Sig.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: This winter, strict deadlines force the fleet to take extreme measures. Vern gambles on an advanced dredge and Emily unleashes a team of all-girl divers on Nome.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer travels to Yorkshire to examine a TVR S2 that is up for auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China experiences a series of problems while working on the TVR S2, which leaves Mike Brewer wondering if it will be ready for him in time to sell at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer finds a Land Rover Discovery for 1,500 and hands it over to mechanic Edd China for restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes working on the Land Rover Discovery and, after a successful road test, Mike Brewer has a buyer lined up.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes a look at the hottest parties happening at the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is hired to sell an Eliminator roadster, owned by automotive journalist Brock Yates, but he must first pick the vehicle up from the Saratoga Automobile Museum.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Derek Hill - the son of legendary auto racer Phil Hill - brings his father's 1912 Packard to the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini searches for more high-end resoration projects, and uncovers numerous Mopar cars, a 1905 Cadillac and a Ferrari 330

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: In Hampshire, Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland uncover a rare 1960s MGC, but clash over how to restyle it. In Dorset, they fall for an '80s BMW 635 Coupe left in a barn for 15 years.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: On the west coast of Cornwall, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove open many sheds in grey, full of classics in all stages of decay. Searching through 50 years of accumulated vintage vehicles, they find the first ever Lotus Elan and a pre-war Sunbeam.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove head to Oxfordshire, where everything the pair look at is oversized and likely over-priced. However, Henry likes a tractor in blue and Sam falls for a Midget racer in a hedge.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton helps a Texan millionaire who wants to collect memorabilia from the Battle of Normandy. He visits farmhouses and museums to find rare items like a 1942 Luger.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a dealer specialising in house clearances, and in Sheffield spots industrial furniture at a 19th-century factory. Later, he finds old punk collectable.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revamp a fragile standing mirror needing some love, a classic armchair and a large railway station clock. Rebecca Pritchard examines their origins.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China embark on a project to restore an original Austin Mini.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work continues on the Austin Mini's restoration, as Edd China and Mike Brewer prepare to return the car to the road.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard gets to drive a 1940s steam engine, and visits a country house to look for more potentially valuable items.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz get a lead on what could be Aerosmith's original tour van, prompting them to head out on a cross-country trek in search of the rock 'n' roll relic.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Artificial Reefs/Earthquake-Proof Buildings/Cars on Rocket Fuel
programme.desc: The creation of an artificial reef by sinking an old warship, the plan to minimise damage to San Francisco when the next earthquake strikes the city and how to run a car on rocket fuel.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How pilots prevent blackouts during high G-force turns, and a look at a robot that can thwart car thieves' chances of escape.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China are fixing up a Mercedes 230E, which is in need of a new wing.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.desc: Bruce Crompton helps a Texan millionaire who wants to collect memorabilia from the Battle of Normandy. He visits farmhouses and museums to find rare items like a 1942 Luger.

programme.title: Airplane Repo

programme.title: Dirty Jobs

programme.title: How It's Made

programme.title: How It's Made

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The engineering expertise that goes into transforming a family car into a fortress on wheels. Plus, millions of perfect Christmas trees are grown.
